p: In the light of reviewed articles, it can also be stated that the Asteraceae/Compositae family plants reported yielding the sesquiterpenes lactones such as amberboin and lipidiol that were having very low inhibitory concentration (IC 50 = 0.8 μM and 0.5 μM, respectively) against acetylcholinesterase. Hence, the herbs from this family could be further explored for plant actives with significant anti-Alzheimer potential.
